name: absorptive
content:

able to take liquids or other substances in through a surface and to hold them: The compound is formed so that it can enable uptake by absorptive cells. the absorptive surfaces of the small intestine Synonym
absorbent
able to be absorbed (= taken in and held or used), for example by the skin or the body: The small molecules of goat's milk make it highly absorptive when rubbed into the skin. absorptive vitamins and minerals
More examplesFewer examplesBecause of its absorptive properties, tapioca flour is often used as a thickening agent in recipes.A physical obstruction can be caused by matter attached to the absorptive layer of the bowel wall.Compression garments and absorptive pads are applied for the immediate postoperative period.Acoustic problems might be caused by a ceiling that's too high or absorptive to bounce the laughter around.Acai is rich in a highly absorptive form of calcium.
